meanings.definition: Rezzes (verb): to bring back to life or restore
meanings.sent1: The magician rezzes the dead bird with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent2: She rezzes old furniture by painting and repairing it.
meanings.sent3: The superhero rezzes the city after the villain's destruction.
meanings.sent4: Her smile rezzes hope in the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The sun rezzes the flowers each morning with its warm rays.

meanings.definition: Rezzes (noun): plural form of rez, meaning a resurrection or revival
meanings.sent1: The graveyard was filled with rezzes of those who had passed away.
meanings.sent2: After the disaster, the town experienced a series of rezzes and new beginnings.
meanings.sent3: The rezzes of old traditions brought a sense of nostalgia to the community.
meanings.sent4: The rezzes of forgotten stories were uncovered in the dusty library archives.
meanings.sent5: The rezzes of the past echoed through the halls of the ancient castle.

meanings.definition: Rezzes (adjective): describing something that has been brought back to life or restored
meanings.sent1: The rezzes garden bloomed with vibrant colors after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The rezzes painting looked as good as new after the restoration.
meanings.sent3: The rezzes car gleamed in the sunlight after the thorough cleaning.
meanings.sent4: Her rezzes smile lit up the room with its warmth and brightness.
meanings.sent5: The rezzes building stood proudly after the renovation work was completed.
